trigger: Ambient indoor CO measured at 0–9 ppm
action_item: Pass. No action required. Continue with weatherization activities and document reading in job file.
documentation: Digital photo or record of CO reading, test location, and time. Upload to IWx.
policy_text: Ambient carbon monoxide levels below 10 ppm are considered safe in living areas per IHWAP and DOE WAP.

trigger: Ambient indoor CO measured at 10–35 ppm
action_item: Open windows/doors for 15 minutes and retest. If CO remains >9 ppm, identify source. If unresolved, defer project until correction.
documentation: CO monitor reading (before and after ventilation), photos of mitigation steps, and source investigation notes in job file.
policy_text: CO 10–35 ppm triggers immediate ventilation, source investigation, and possible deferral if levels persist.

trigger: Ambient indoor CO measured above 35 ppm
action_item: Evacuate occupants immediately. Call emergency services. Auto-deferral for all weatherization until CO is corrected and retest passes (≤9 ppm).
documentation: Photo of reading, incident log, documentation of emergency contact, clearance from professional.
policy_text: CO >35 ppm is an emergency; evacuation and full deferral are required.

action_item: Indicates possible non-appliance source (e.g., attached garage, vehicle exhaust, ambient air issue). Investigate and correct source. Defer project until levels return to ≤9 ppm.
documentation: Test protocol record, photos, and notes on all investigation and corrective steps.
policy_text: If CO persists when all appliances are off, defer until non-appliance source is corrected.

action_item: Identify which appliance is causing elevated CO. Service, repair, or replace as needed. Defer work if CO remains >9 ppm after appliance correction.
documentation: Appliance operation log, CO readings by appliance, service records.
policy_text: WCD (worst case depressurization) testing determines appliance contribution to indoor CO.

action_item: Educate client on garage ventilation; recommend not idling vehicles in garage. If persistent CO migrates into home, recommend air sealing and ventilation corrections.
documentation: CO readings, garage inspection photos, client education form.
policy_text: Attached garages are a common source of ambient CO; mitigation steps required if migration detected.

trigger: CO alarm present but not functioning/tested
action_item: Replace or test CO alarm before proceeding with work. Document installation or test. Required by IHWAP/DOE for all weatherized homes.
policy_text: Operational CO alarms are required in all homes receiving weatherization.
